column4: UPDATE 4-Charter launches US$15.5bn M&A bond for Time Warner

The split-rated trade had amassed more than US$40bn of orders at the time it was launched  allowing Charter to tighten pricing on all six tranches. column5: ADAPAZARI  Turkey  July 9 The Turkish unit of Toyota Motor Corp saw first-half exports slump by 30 percent after a weaker rouble hit Russia's car market  but hopes to pare losses with sales domestically and to Europe  the unit's chief executive said.

column4: United Airlines expects profit margin in lower range of outlook
column5: United Continental Holdings Inc  said on Thursday its pretax profit margin for the second quarter will be in the lower range of its earlier outlook and said the strong U.S. dollar has hurt demand from travelers abroad.

column4: United Tech faces growth challenges as Sikorsky divestment nears
column5: As United Technologies Corp  nears a decision on how it will divest its Sikorsky helicopter division  the U.S. conglomerate faces challenges to its financial outlook that may limit the lift to its stock in the near term.
